title: Maro Itoje pledges solidarity with footballers racially abused in Bulgaria: 'It was appalling – but never assume rugby is free from discrimination'
text:
Maro Itoje has expressed his dismay about the racism England’s footballers were subjected to in Bulgaria and warned rugby not to assume the upsurge in abuse will leave the oval ball game unaffected.

Itoje, who leads the way for ethnic minority players at England level, says he knows of rugby players who have been abused “in different parts of the world” and said: “I think it’s important never to just assume that this is a free zone from any form of discrimination. I think rugby is probably – from the sports that I’ve seen – right up there in terms of integrity, in terms of respect and in terms of how they treat people.
